dt: {bc}conscious abandonment of allegiance or duty (as to a person, cause, or doctrine) {bc}{sx|desertion||}

et: borrowed from Latin {it}dēfectiōn-, dēfectiō{/it} "falling short, failure, abandonment of allegiance," from {it}dēficere{/it} "to be lacking, fail, become disaffected, go over (to the side of an opponent)" + {it}-tiōn-, -tiō,{/it} suffix of verbal action {ma}{mat|deficient|}{/ma}
shortdef: conscious abandonment of allegiance or duty (as to a person, cause, or doctrine) : desertion
